trans-unit.source: Step 1: Sign up for an Account
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Sign up for an Account

trans-unit.source: This is the first of seven tasks required to create a basic <token>indigo1</token> service and a client that can call the service that uses <token>sb1</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the first of seven tasks required to create a basic <token>indigo1</token> service and a client that can call the service that uses <token>sb1</token>.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of all seven tasks, see the <link xlink:href="24332c3c-277f-46f2-949a-d4381b8bfb0b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">AppFabric Service Bus Tutorial</link> overview.
trans-unit.target: For an overview of all seven tasks, see the <link xlink:href="24332c3c-277f-46f2-949a-d4381b8bfb0b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">AppFabric Service Bus Tutorial</link> overview.

trans-unit.source: The next task is <link xlink:href="62374996-f88d-45aa-bfa4-17ff5a3fb62e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 2: Define a WCF Service Contract</link>.
trans-unit.target: The next task is <link xlink:href="62374996-f88d-45aa-bfa4-17ff5a3fb62e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 2: Define a WCF Service Contract</link>.

trans-unit.source: The first step is to create a <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token>, and to obtain a <newTerm>Shared Access Signature</newTerm> (SAS) key.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to create a <token>sb2</token> <token>servicensd</token>, and to obtain a <newTerm>Shared Access Signature</newTerm> (SAS) key.

trans-unit.source: A <token>servicensd</token> provides an application boundary for each application exposed through the <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: A <token>servicensd</token> provides an application boundary for each application exposed through the <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The combination of <token>servicensd</token> and SAS key provides a credential for the <token>sb2</token> to authenticate access to an application.
trans-unit.target: The combination of <token>servicensd</token> and SAS key provides a credential for the <token>sb2</token> to authenticate access to an application.

trans-unit.source: To create a service namespace and obtain a SAS key
trans-unit.target: To create a service namespace and obtain a SAS key

trans-unit.source: To create a <token>servicensd</token>, follow the steps outlined in <link xlink:href="fa561f70-007c-45aa-b34d-56317dbbfc87" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create or Modify a Service Bus Service Namespace</link>.
trans-unit.target: To create a <token>servicensd</token>, follow the steps outlined in <link xlink:href="fa561f70-007c-45aa-b34d-56317dbbfc87" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create or Modify a Service Bus Service Namespace</link>.

trans-unit.source: You do not have to use the same <token>servicensd</token> for both client and service applications.
trans-unit.target: You do not have to use the same <token>servicensd</token> for both client and service applications.

trans-unit.source: In the main window of the Azure management portal, click the name of the <token>servicensd</token> you created in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: In the main window of the Azure management portal, click the name of the <token>servicensd</token> you created in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Configure</ui> to view the default shared access policies for your <token>servicensd</token>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Configure</ui> to view the default shared access policies for your <token>servicensd</token>.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the primary key for the <ui>RootManageSharedAccessKey</ui> policy, or copy it to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the primary key for the <ui>RootManageSharedAccessKey</ui> policy, or copy it to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: You will use this value later in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will use this value later in this tutorial.
